rationale: The Information and Communication Technology diploma holders are required to use and maintain various types of electrical and electronics communication equipments. The knowledge of the concepts of basic electrical engineering with the functions of various basic electronic devices and components and practical skills acquired through the laboratory experiments will help the diploma holders to arrive at the probable solutions when they work with electrical and electronic equipment and its sub-circuits. This course is designed to develop the skills to use the basics electronic components and apply the knowledge to maintain the various types of electrical and electronics circuits.
competency: Apply basic principles of electrical and electronics in various engineering applications.

courseOutcomes.description: Use D.C. and A.C. fundamentals to solve basic problems of electrical and electronics engineering.
Demonstrate the functionality of Semiconductor diodes.
Demonstrate the characteristics and functions of different types of semiconductor diodes.
Build and test the different types of rectifiers using PN junction diode.
Compare and apply various transistor configurations.

practicalExercises.description: Verify Kirchoff's current law and Kirchoff's voltage law in the given electric circuit.
Verify Superposition theorem and determine the current and voltage in each branch of the given circuit.
Verify the Thevenin's theorem and determine the voltage and current in the given branch of the circuit.
Verify the Norton's theorem and determine the voltage and current in the given branch of the circuit.
Test the performance of PN junction diode and obtain forward Voltage drop and diode current.
Build and test the half wave rectifier on a breadboard.
Build and test the output of the full wave center tap rectifier on a bread board.
Build and test the full wave bridge rectifier on a breadboard.
Test the performance of half and full wave rectifier with π filter.
Test the performance of the zener diode and obtain the Zener breakdown (Reverse) voltage and current
Build and test zener voltage regulator for the given regulated voltage.
Test the performance of LED and measure the current and voltage.
Test common emitter transistor configuration and obtain the current gain and input impedance.

specificationTable.unitTitle: Fundamentals of Electrical Circuits (D.C. & A.C.) and Network Theorems

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Digital Multimeter: 3 1/2 digit display, 1999 count digital multimeter measures: Vac, Vdc (600V max), Idc, Iac (10 amp max), Resistance (0-2 MΩ) with diode and transistor tester
Dual variable DC power supply, 0-30V, 2A, With Short circuit protection, separate display for voltage and current
Cathode Ray Oscilloscope, Dual Trace 20 MHz, 1 MΩ Input Impedance
Function Generator 0-2 MHz with Sine, square and triangular output with variable frequency and amplitude

Electronic Workbench: Bread Board 840-1000 contact points: Positive and Negative DC power rails on opposite sides of the board with, 0-30 V, 2 Amp Variable DC power supply, Function Generator 0-2 MHz, CRO 0-30 MHz, Digital Multimeter
software: Multisim for Analog and Electronics Circuit design and simulation

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member

underpinningTheory.unitTitle: Fundamentals of Electrical Circuits (D.C. & A.C.) and Network Theorems

unitOutcomes.description: Define the various electrical parameters and determine the current, voltage and resistance in an electric circuit using Ohm's Law.
Identify the commonly used materials and components used in electrical engineering.
Define the terms work, power and energy.
Calculate voltage and current in the given resistive circuits using KCL and KVL.
Calculate voltage and current of resistive circuits using Mesh and nodal analysis method.
Classify types of electrical circuits.
Calculate voltage, current and resistance using Superposition Theorem, Thevenin's Theorem, Norton's Theorem. State Reciprocity Theorem.
Explain generation of alternating EMF, Define various electrical parameters, Derive equation for RMS and average value of sinusoidal wave.

Compare the behavior of AC voltage, current and power through pure resistive, pure inductive and pure capacitive load. Define the terms active power, reactive power and power factor with power triangle, the concept of lag and lead.

topics.title: Basic Electrical Parameters
subtopics: Charge, Current, Potential, voltage, power, Energy Electrical Resistance and its Unit
Ohms law: applications and limitations
Specific Resistance and its unit
Parameters affecting the resistance
Effect of temperature on resistance and temperature co-efficient
potential difference; EMF

topics.title: Electrical Materials
subtopics: Conductors, Insulators, semiconductors
capacitors and inductors

topics.title: Work, Power and Energy
subtopics: Definitions of Work, Power and Energy (both electrical and mechanical)

topics.title: Circuit Analysis Basics
subtopics: Concept of Open circuit, Closed circuit, Short circuits
Definitions of node, branch, loop, mesh
Kirchhoff's laws and simple numerical
Kirchhoff's Voltage and Current law (KVL and KCL)

topics.title: Network Analysis Methods
subtopics: Mesh Analysis and Nodal Analysis of Networks

topics.title: Circuit Classifications
subtopics: Linear & Nonlinear circuit
Active and Passive Network

topics.title: Network Theorems
subtopics: Super Position Theorem
Thevenin's Theorem
Norton's Theorem
Maximum Power Transfer Theorem
Reciprocity Theorem

topics.title: AC Fundamentals
subtopics: Principle of generating an alternating voltage
Cycle, Time period, Frequency, Amplitude, Phase and Phase difference
Average value, R.M.S. value, Form factor, Peak Factor and Power Factor

topics.title: AC Circuit Analysis
subtopics: Waveforms, phasor diagram and expression of voltage, current and power in pure: Resistance, Inductance and Capacitance
Active, reactive and apparent power (Lagging, leading power and unity power factor)

unitOutcomes.description: Explain atomic structure and conductivity
Explain Energy band diagram and Conductor, semiconductor and Insulators
Describe Semiconductors and conductivity

topics.title: Atomic Structure
subtopics: Structure of atom of trivalent, tetravalent pentavalent materials
valence electron, free electrons, energy levels

topics.title: Energy Band Theory
subtopics: Energy band diagram of conductor, semiconductor and insulator

topics.title: Semiconductor Types
subtopics: Doping, Intrinsic semiconductor, extrinsic semiconductor

topics.title: Charge Carriers
subtopics: P-type and N-type semiconductor
majority - minority charge carrier and conductivity

unitOutcomes.description: Describe the working, characteristics and applications of P-N junction diode.
Describe the working, characteristics and applications of Zener diode.
Describe the working, characteristics and applications of LED, OLED, Photodiode, Laser diode, Varactor Diode

topics.title: PN Junction Formation
subtopics: P-N junction, Depletion layer, knee voltage

topics.title: PN Junction Working
subtopics: P-N junction diode forward bias, reverse bias working

topics.title: Diode Characteristics
subtopics: P-N junction diode voltage-current characteristics

topics.title: Zener Diode
subtopics: Zener diode: Working, characteristics and applications

topics.title: Special Purpose Diodes
subtopics: Working characteristics and applications of LED, OLED, Photodiode, Laser diode, Varactor Diode

topics.title: Diode Data Sheets
subtopics: Diodes data sheet

unitOutcomes.description: Describe performance of various types of rectifiers.
Discuss function of rectifier filters
Describe Zener diode voltage regulator

topics.title: Rectifier Fundamentals
subtopics: Rectifier: Need of rectifier

topics.title: Rectifier Types
subtopics: Types of rectifiers: Half wave rectifier, Full wave centre tap and bridge rectifier
circuit operation, input-output waveforms, output voltage, ripple frequency, ripple factor
PIV of a diode, efficiency of half wave and full wave rectifiers

topics.title: Rectifier Filters
subtopics: Need of rectifier filter
Types of filter: Shunt capacitor filter and π filter

topics.title: Voltage Regulation
subtopics: Zener diode as a voltage regulator

unitOutcomes.description: Differentiate between PNP and NPN transistor constructions, working and their applications.
Differentiate different types of transistors configurations.
Introduction to FET (JFET and MOSFET)
Justify the need of electronic waste methods.

topics.title: BJT Fundamentals
subtopics: Symbol, Construction, Characteristic and Working of BJT (NPN and PNP transistors)

topics.title: Transistor Configurations
subtopics: Transistor CE, CB and CC configurations: circuit diagram, input and output characteristics
Different regions of characteristics (cutoff, active and saturation)
input resistance, output resistance, current gain

topics.title: Current Gain Relations
subtopics: Relation between current gains alpha and beta

topics.title: Field Effect Transistors
subtopics: Symbol, Construction, Characteristic, working of JFET and MOSFET

topics.title: Electronic Waste Management
subtopics: Concept of electronic waste

studentActivities: Prepare a table and interpret the technical specification of various diodes and transistors using data sheet
Collect information and give seminar on any relevant topic related with the course
Undertake a market survey of different semiconductor components
Prepare a survey report different electronic waste management adopted by the local electronics industry
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students to find micro project using electronic components through internet
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability and Introduce E-waste recycling technology among the students

microProjects.title: +5Vdc Unregulated Power Supply
microProjects.description: Build a circuit for +5Vdc unregulated power supply using half wave rectifier on general purpose PCB.

microProjects.title: +12Vdc Unregulated Power Supply
microProjects.description: Build a circuit for +12Vdc unregulated power supply using center-tap full wave rectifier or bridge rectifier on general purpose PCB.

microProjects.title: LED Indicator Circuit
microProjects.description: Build a circuit using LED and rectifier which shows the working of LED as indicator on general purpose PCB.

microProjects.title: Zener Voltage Regulator
microProjects.description: Build a circuit voltage regulator using zener diode on general purpose PCB.

microProjects.title: Common Emitter Amplifier
microProjects.description: Build a circuit of common emitter amplifier using transistor and prepare a mini project report.

microProjects.title: Electronic Waste Report
microProjects.description: Electronic Waste: Prepare a report of strategies regarding handling of electronic waste with figures, tables and comparative charts.
